citation.article-title: Actinomyces canis sp. nov., isolated from dogs
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Actinomyces canis sp. nov
Actinomyces canis (can.is. L. gen. n. canis of the dog)
Cells are straight to slightly curved rods, some of which exhibit branching.
Cells stain Gram-positive, are non-aciD-fast and are non-motile.
With API systems, acid is produced from fglucose, L-arabinose, glycogen, maltose, lactose, pullulan, D-ribose and dxylose.
Acid is not produced from D-arabitol, cyclodextrin, mannitol, melibiose, melezitose, methyl β-D- glucopyranoside, sorbitol, tagatose or trehalose.
Aesculin, gelatin and hippurate are not hydrolysed.
Acid may or may not be produced from sucrose and raffinose.

Alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-galacturonidase, aglucosidase, α-fucosidase, ester lipase C-8 (weak), cystine arylamidase (weak), leucine arylamidase, NacetyL- β-glucosaminidase and pyrazinamidase (weak reaction) are produced.

Arginine dihydrolase, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, chymotrypsin, esterase C-4, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, α-mannosidase, β-mannosidase, lipase C-14, phosphoamidase, trypsin, valine arylamidase, pyrrolydonyl arylamidase and urease are not produced.
Glycyl tryptophan arylamidase may or may not be produced.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Isolated from clinical specimens from dogs.
The type strain shows the characteristics of the species and produces acid from sucrose and raffinose.
